description.value:
Imix makes two slam attacks or two flame blast attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod + 1 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 5d6 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 250 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 10d6 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

Imix summons up to three &Reference[fire]{fire} elemental;fire elementals and loses 30 hit points for each &Reference[elemental]{elemental} he summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Imix, and disappear if Imix is reduced to 0 hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

Imix is master of heat and flames in his vicinity. He can take lair actions on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, or in any &Reference[elemental]{elemental} &Reference[fire]{fire} node (such as the Weeping Colossus in chapter 5). On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Imix uses his lair action to cause one of the following effects:

  • Any fires in the lair flare up drastically, quadrupling in size (for example, a &Reference[fire]{fire} blazing in a 5-foot by 5-foot area expands to a 10-foot by 10-foot area). Pools or streams of lava or other molten &Reference[material]{material} are also affected. Creatures caught in the area of an expanded &Reference[fire]{fire} are subject to the normal damage for entering or being in the &Reference[fire]{fire}. Creatures caught by a sudden flood of lava must succeed on a [[/save str 20 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}, in addition to the normal damage for contact with molten rock.
  • A thick cloud of black smoke and burning embers fills a 40-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} within 120 feet of Imix, lasting until initiative count 20 of the next round. Creatures and objects within or beyond the smoke are heavily obscured. A creature that enters the cloud of embers for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes [[/damage 3d6 type=fire average=true]] damage.
  • A wave of searing heat fills the lair in a 300-foot radius around Imix for an instant. Each creature other than Imix in the area must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or take 1d[[/damage 8 fire average=false]] damage. Creatures that take &Reference[fire]{fire} damage from this effect gain one level of &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion}. In addition, there is a fifty percent chance that any container of fluid held or carried by an affected creature (for example, a magic potion) is destroyed.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} node in which Imix is present becomes vulnerable to the influence of &Reference[fire]{fire}. This creates the following effects:

  • A dry, baking heat wave strikes the region within 10 miles of Imix’s location. At first, effects are minor — grass turns brown, animals become listless, work and travel become very tiring. The longer Imix remains, the worse the heat becomes; after 5 days, crops die and ponds dry up; after 10 days, unprotected livestock dies, and wells and small rivers dry up; after 20 days, large lakes and rivers are reduced in depth by 20 feet and shrink accordingly.
  • Wildfires erupt within a 5-mile radius of Imix’s lair. Every hour, there is a ten percent chance that characters in this area are caught in the path of a wildfire moving 50 feet per round. Each character must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 3d6 type=fire average=true]] damage. A wildfire continues to threaten the characters for 1d10 rounds or until they get out of its path. Wooden structures caught in the wildfire are destroyed.
  • Lava fountains erupt from the ground within 1 mile of Imix’s lair. Every hour, there is a ten percent chance that characters in this area are close enough to an erupting lava fountain to be in danger. A lava fountain creates a vent 20 feet in diameter, and hurls globs of lava up to 200 feet away. Each character within this area must succeed on a [[/save dex 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d10 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 5d6 type=fire average=true]] damage. A fountain lasts for 2d10 rounds before subsiding.
  • Wildfires or volcanic fissures within 1 mile of Imix’s lair form intermittent portals to the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, allowing &Reference[elemental]{elemental} creatures into the mortal world to dwell near those points.

If Imix is destroyed or banished back to his home plane, the regional effects fade over the next 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Imix’s Lair


Imix’s home is a fiery inverted pyramid within a volcano on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire}. This fortress-palace is known as the Temple of Ultimate Consumption. Imix is quick to answer calls from the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane, since he hungers eternally for new forests, plains, and kingdoms to burn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Imix can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Imix regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Heat Wave. Imix creates a blast of heat within 300 feet of himself. Each creature in the area in physical contact with metal objects (for example, carrying metal weapons or wearing metal armor) takes [[/damage 2d8 type=fire average=true]] damage. Each creature in the area that isn’t resistant or immune to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or gain one level of &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion}.

Teleport (Costs 2 Actions). Imix magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Imix is wearing or carrying isn’t teleported with him.

Combustion (Costs 3 Actions). Imix causes one creature he can see within 30 feet of him to burst into flames. The target must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 20d6 type=fire average=true]] damage and catches &Reference[fire]{fire}. A target on &Reference[fire]{fire} takes [[/damage 3d6 type=fire average=true]] damage when it starts its turn, and remains on &Reference[fire]{fire} until it or another creature takes an action to douse the flames. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn’t catch &Reference[fire]{fire}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Imix creates a blast of heat within 300 feet of himself. Each creature in the area in physical contact with metal objects (for example, carrying metal weapons or wearing metal armor) takes [[/damage 2d8 type=fire average=true]] damage. Each creature in the area that isn’t resistant or immune to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or gain one level of &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Imix magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Imix is wearing or carrying isn’t teleported with him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Imix causes one creature he can see within 30 feet of him to burst into flames. The target must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 20d6 type=fire average=true]] damage and catches &Reference[fire]{fire}. A target on &Reference[fire]{fire} takes [[/damage 3d6 type=fire average=true]] damage when it starts its turn, and remains on &Reference[fire]{fire} until it or another creature takes an action to douse the flames. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn’t catch &Reference[fire]{fire}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Empowered Attacks. Imix’s slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[fire]{Fire} Aura. At the start of each of Imix’s turns, each creature within 10 feet of him takes 17 (5d6) &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren’t being worn or carried ignite. A creature also takes 17 (5d6) &Reference[fire]{fire} damage if it touches Imix or hits him with a melee attack while within 10 feet of him, and a creature takes that damage the first time on a turn that Imix moves into its space. Nonmagical weapons that hit Imix are destroyed by &Reference[fire]{fire} immediately after dealing damage to him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[fire]{Fire} Form. Imix can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. He can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing if &Reference[fire]{fire} could pass through that space.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Illumination. Imix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Imix fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Imix’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: fireball, wall of &Reference[fire]{fire}

3/day each: &Reference[fire]{fire} storm, haste, teleport

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Imix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A target takes 8d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You create a wall of &Reference[fire]{fire} on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

A storm made up of sheets of roaring flame appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each &Reference[cube]{cube} must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another &Reference[cube]{cube}. Each creature in the area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. It takes 7d10 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, &Reference[plant]{plant} life in the area is unaffected by this spell.

system.chatFlavor: [7d10 - fire] Can choose to not affect plants in the area

description.value:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target’s speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

When the spell ends, the target can’t move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 10-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

The destination you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the destination determines whether you arrive there successfully. The GM rolls d100 and consults the table.

Familiarity Mishap Similar Area Off Target On Target
Permanent circle - - - 01-100
Associated object - - - 01-100
Very familiar 01-05 06-13 14-24 25-100
Seen casually 01-33 34-43 44-53 54-100
Viewed once 01-43 44-53 54-73 74-100
Description 01-43 44-53 54-73 74-100
False destination 01-50 51-100 - -

 

Familiarity. "Permanent circle" means a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know. "Associated object" means that you possess an object taken from the desired destination within the last six months, such as a book from a wizard's library, bed linen from a royal suite, or a chunk of marble from a lich's secret tomb.

"Very familiar" is a place you have been very often, a place you have carefully studied, or a place you can see when you cast the spell. "Seen casually" is someplace you have seen more than once but with which you aren't very familiar. "Viewed once" is a place you have seen once, possibly using magic. "Description" is a place whose location and appearance you know through someone else's description, perhaps from a map.

"False destination" is a place that doesn't exist. Perhaps you tried to scry an enemy's sanctum but instead viewed an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, or you are attempting to teleport to a familiar location that no longer exists.

On Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear where you want to.

Off Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear a random distance away from the destination in a random direction. Distance off target is 1d10 × 1d10 percent of the distance that was to be traveled. For example, if you tried to travel 120 miles, landed off target, and rolled a 5 and 3 on the two d10s, then you would be off target by 15 percent, or 18 miles. The GM determines the direction off target randomly by rolling a d8 and designating 1 as north, 2 as northeast, 3 as east, and so on around the points of the compass. If you were teleporting to a coastal city and wound up 18 miles out at sea, you could be in trouble.

Similar Area. You and your group (or the target object) wind up in a different area that's visually or thematically similar to the target area. If you are heading for your home laboratory, for example, you might wind up in another wizard's laboratory or in an alchemical supply shop that has many of the same tools and implements as your laboratory. Generally, you appear in the closest similar place, but since the spell has no range limit, you could conceivably wind up anywhere on the plane.

Mishap. The spell's unpredictable magic results in a difficult journey. Each teleporting creature (or the target object) takes 3d10 &Reference[force]{force} damage, and the GM rerolls on the table to see where you wind up (multiple mishaps can occur, dealing damage each time).
